page.title: 02TOURISM IN ULLAPOOL,W.ROSS.
page.content: Ullapool, the largest village in Wester Ross has been called the 'Jewel of the North'.Many tourists visit it for its magnificent scenery and its tranquility.It is situated on the shores of Lochbroom surrounded by challenging hills and mountains for the climbers and dams,lochs and rivers for the anglers. Ullapool is a quiet,little village,well-known as a fishing port,where one can watch the arrival and departure of the Stornoway Ferry or the unloading of fish from various types of fishing boats.At the pier the visitor may choose a cruise to the Summer Isles to view sea birds,seals, admire the sunsets for which the area is famous,or experience deep-sea angling.The sheltered waters are ideal for boats,canoes,yachts,windsurfing and water-skiing. .
